intro: Androsace robusta, commonly known as the robust sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink, blooming in early summer. Its leaves are usually fleshy and succulent, adapted to retain moisture in arid or rocky environments. Androsace robusta thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
